page.title: 11PUBLIC SERVICES - WATER
page.content: The{water supply}comes from Stanbridge Mill Works, situated beside the River Allen & owned by Bournemouth & District Water Co. First developed in l946-50 when two 27 in. diameter boreholes were sunk in the chalk to the depth of 300 ft. The station is unmanned and is operated by remote control from the company's Alderney Works 11 miles away. Its full potential is 5.5 million gallons per day. Pumping plant raises water from 4 boreholes to Chalbury Reservoir, 112 ft. higher than Alderney Works. It flows by gravity into network carrying water to 80,000 homes over 136 sq. miles for l75,000 people plus 100,000 summer visitors.
